subject: Business
title: Opportunity Cost: The Road Not Taken
description: A 60-second lesson on Opportunity Cost: The Road Not Taken.

hook.text: You buy a $1,200 phone. The real cost isn't $1,200 â€” it's the $1,200 investment that would've grown to $5,000 in 15.

buildup.text: Opportunity cost is the value of the next best alternative you give up when making a choice.

discovery.text: Every dollar spent is also a dollar not invested, not saved, and not used for something else.

twist.text: Free things have opportunity costs too. Time spent scrolling social media is time not spent learning or earning.

climax.text: Jeff Bezos used opportunity cost to leave a Wall Street job: the regret of not trying Amazon outweighed the risk.

punchline.text: Every 'yes' is a hidden 'no' to something else.

quiz.question: What is opportunity cost?
options: The value of the next best alternative you give up
The price printed on a product label
A tax charged on investment returns
